subtitle: This dish is prepared ahead and served cold - a perfect centre-piece for a buffet party or when entertaining a crowd.

method.text: Heat the butter in a large frying pan. Fry the onion for 2-3 min or until soft. Remove from heat and stir in the breadcrumbs, herbs, nuts, apricots, seasoning and egg. Mix well, adding a little water if necessary to form a firm moist stuffing.
Place the boned chicken skin side down on a clean work surface. Spread half the mixture over the centre of the bird and top with the gammon then top with remaining stuffing.

Tuck the neck end in and draw the long sides of the chicken over the stuffing. Carefully sew or truss the chicken together and weigh the bird to calculate the cooking time. Allow 25 min per 450 g plus an extra 25 min.

Place the stuffed chicken in a roasting pan in the preheated oven for as long as calculated. Test to see whether the chicken is cooked by inserting a skewer into the chicken itself (not the stuffing) and if the juices run clear, the chicken is ready. If the chicken isn't cooked, simply pop it in the oven for a little longer.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool before chilling overnight.
Serve the chicken cut into slices.

title: Partytime chicken
